intro: Rauvolfia lycioides, commonly known as the smallleaf rosenbergia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Rauvolfia lycioides is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
